info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:06AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG SHOWERS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON... SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER...ALLEGHENY...WESTERN WESTMORELAND...SOUTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG AND NORTH CENTRAL FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 AM EDT... At 1106 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers along a line extending from near Mars to near East Washington. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, McMurray, McKeesport, Franklin Park, Jeannette, and Vandergrift. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 26 and 30, and between mile markers 42 and 56. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 33 and 73. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 53 and 58. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 64 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
